program.name: matplotlib
program.script-header:
_docdir="${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/doc"
_gccsubdir="gcc44"
export TCL_LIBRARY="${SB_VAR_TCL_LIB}/tcl8.5" export TK_LIBRARY="${SB_VAR_TK_LIB}/tk8.5"
export PKG_CONFIG_PATH="\ ${SB_VAR_FCPACKAGE_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_GETTEXT_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBATK_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBCAIRO_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBFFI_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBGDKPIXBUF_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBGLIB_LIB}/${_gccsubdir}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBGTK_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBICONV_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBPANGO_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBPNG_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBTTF_LIB}/pkgconfig:\ ${SB_VAR_LIBZ_LIB}/pkgconfig"
program.configure:
${SB_PATH_SED} -i -e "\ s!@LIBTTF@!${SB_VAR_LIBTTF}!; \ s!@LIBPNG@!${SB_VAR_LIBPNG}!; \ s!@LIBZ@!${SB_VAR_LIBZ}!; \ s!@TK@!${SB_VAR_TK}!; \ s!@TCL@!${SB_VAR_TCL}!; \ s!@EXTRA_LIBRARIES@!${SB_VAR_FCPACKAGE_LIB}!;" setupext.py
cat >setup.cfg <<_EOT_ [gui_support] gtk = True gtkagg = True tkagg = True wxagg = True
[rc_options] backend = GTKAgg _EOT_
${SB_PATH_CHMOD} 644 lib/matplotlib/mpl-data/images/*.svg
program.install:
${SB_VAR_PYTHON}/bin/python setup.py install -O1 --skip-build \ --install-lib=${_install_prefix} --prefix=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}
# install path for Python's include.paths.d ${SB_PATH_INSTALL} -m 755 -o root -g 0 -d \ ${_install_prefix}/include.paths.d cat >${_install_prefix}/include.paths.d/99-${SB_PROG_NAME} <<_EOT_ ${_install_prefix} _EOT_

item.para: Fix bug that Text.Annotation is still drawn while set to not visible.
The pdf backend now escapes newlines and linefeeds in strings.
texmanager.make_dvi now raises an error if LaTeX failed to create an output file.
_png.read_png() reads 12 bit PNGs
Fix bugs in edge color handling by contourf.
Ensure wx version >= 2.8.
Support image clipping in pdf backend.
Move plot_directive.py to the installed source tree. Add support for inline code content
Move mathmpl.py to the installed source tree so it is available to other projects.
Fix bug in mathtext related to \dots and \ldots
Document 'resolution' kwarg for polar plots. Support it when using pyplot.polar, not just Figure.add_axes.
Make curves and NaNs play nice together
Fix bug in quiver argument handling.
Fix bug in backend_gtk: don't delete nonexistent toolbar.
Fix bug in is_string_like so it doesn't raise an unnecessary exception.
Bugfix of C typedef of MPL_Int64 that was failing on Windows XP 64 bit.
Fix bug in pan/zoom with log coordinates.
Fix bug in setting of dashed negative contours.
Be fault tolerant when len(linestyles)>NLev in contour.
fix the dpi-dependent offset of Shadow.
fix the hatch bug in the pdf backend. minor update in docs and example
Update Axes.legend documnetation. /api/api_changes.rst is also updated to describe chages in keyword parameters. Issue a warning if old keyword parameters are used.
Removed configobj, experimental traits and doc/mpl_data link
Fix bug where a line with NULL data limits prevents subsequent data limits from calculating correctly
Major documentation generator changes
Applied macosx backend patch with support for path collections, quadmesh, etc...
fix dpi-dependent behavior of text bbox and arrow in annotate
Another attempt to fix dpi-dependent behavior of Legend.
Fixed dpi-dependent behavior of Legend and fancybox in Text.

Removed mpl_data symlink in docs. On platforms that do not support symlinks, these become copies, and the font files are large, so the distro becomes unneccessarily bloaded. Keeping the mpl_examples dir because relative links are harder for the plot directive and the *.py files are not so large.
Fix \$ in non-math text with usetex off. Document differences between usetex on/off
Fix anti-aliasing when auto-snapping
Fix grid lines not moving correctly during pan and zoom
Fixed warning in hist() with numpy 1.2
Use subprocess.Popen instead of os.popen in dviread
Added a font_manager fix and figure/subplot fix
Added mdehoon's native macosx backend
Removed the prints in the set_*style commands. Return the list of pprinted strings instead

Some of the changes Michael made to improve the output of the property tables in the rest docs broke of made difficult to use some of the interactive doc helpers, eg setp and getp. Having all the rest markup in the ipython shell also confused the docstrings. I added a new rc param docstring.harcopy, to format the docstrings differently for hardcopy and other use. Ther ArtistInspector could use a little refactoring now since there is duplication of effort between the rest out put and the non-rest output
Updated spectral methods (psd, csd, etc.) to scale one-sided densities by a factor of 2 and, optionally, scale all densities by the sampling frequency. This gives better MatLab compatibility.
Fixed alignment of ticks in colorbars.
drop the deprecated "new" keyword of np.histogram() for numpy 1.2 or later.
Fixed a bug in svg backend that new_figure_manager() ignores keywords arguments such as figsize, etc.
Fixed a bug that the handlelength of the new legend class set too short when numpoints=1
Added support for data with units (e.g. dates) to Axes.fill_between.
Added fancybox keyword to legend. Also applied some changes for better look, including baseline adjustment of the multiline texts so that it is center aligned.
The transmuter classes in the patches.py are reorganized as subclasses of the Style classes. A few more box and arrow styles are added.
Fixed a bug in the new legend class that didn't allowed a tuple of coordinate vlaues as loc.
Improve checks for external dependencies, using subprocess (instead of deprecated popen*) and distutils (for version checking)
Reimplementaion of the legend which supports baseline alignement, multi-column, and expand mode.
Fixed histogram autoscaling bug when bins or range are given explicitly (fixes Debian bug 503148)
Added rcParam axes.unicode_minus which allows plain hypen for minus when False
Added scatterpoints support in Legend.
Fix crash in log ticking.
Added static helper method BrokenHBarCollection.span_where and Axes/pyplot method fill_between. See examples/pylab/fill_between.py

Add x_isdata and y_isdata attributes to Artist instances, and use them to determine whether either or both coordinates are used when updating dataLim. This is used to fix autoscaling problems that had been triggered by axhline, axhspan, axvline, axvspan.

Update the psd(), csd(), cohere(), and specgram() methods of Axes and the csd() cohere(), and specgram() functions in mlab to be in sync with the changes to psd(). In fact, under the hood, these all call the same core to do computations.

Add 'pad_to' and 'sides' parameters to mlab.psd() to allow controlling of zero padding and returning of negative frequency components, respecitively. These are added in a way that does not change the API.
Fix handling of c kwarg by scatter; generalize is_string_like to accept numpy and numpy.ma string array scalars.
Fix a possible EINTR problem in dviread, which might help when saving pdf files from the qt backend.
Fix bug with zoom to rectangle and twin axes
Added fancy arrow, box and annotation enhancements -- see examples/pylab_examples/annotation_demo2.py
Autoscaling is now supported with shared axes
Fixed exception in dviread that happened with Minion
set_xlim, ylim now return a copy of the viewlim array to avoid modify inplace surprises
Added image thumbnail generating function matplotlib.image.thumbnail. See examples/misc/image_thumbnail.py
Applied scatleg patch
Fixed bug in pdf backend: if you pass a file object for output instead of a filename, e.g. in a wep app, we now flush the object at the end.
Add path simplification support to paths with gaps.
Fix problem with AFM files that don't specify the font's full name or family name.
Added 'scilimits' kwarg to Axes.ticklabel_format() method, for easy access to the set_powerlimits method of the major ScalarFormatter.
Experimental new kwarg borderpad to replace pad in legend
Allow spy to ignore zero values in sparse arrays, based on patch by Tony Yu. Also fixed plot to handle empty data arrays, and fixed handling of markers in figlegend.
Introduce drawstyles for lines. Transparently split linestyles like 'steps--' into drawstyle 'steps' and linestyle '--'. Legends always use drawstyle 'default'.
Fixed quiver and quiverkey bugs (failure to scale properly when resizing) and added additional methods for determining the arrow angles
Fix polar interpolation to handle negative values of theta

Reorganized cbook and mlab methods related to numerical calculations that have little to do with the goals of those two modules into a separate module numerical_methods.py Also, added ability to select points and stop point selection with keyboard in ginput and manual contour labeling code. Finally, fixed contour labeling bug.
Fix backtick in Postscript output.

[ 2089958 ] Path simplification for vector output backends Leverage the simplification code exposed through path_to_polygons to simplify certain well-behaved paths in the vector backends (PDF, PS and SVG). "path.simplify" must be set to True in matplotlibrc for this to work.
Add "filled" kwarg to Path.intersects_path and Path.intersects_bbox.
Changed full arrows slightly to avoid an xpdf rendering problem
Fix conversion of quadratic to cubic Bezier curves in PDF and PS backends.
Added 5-point star marker to plot command
Fix hatching in PS backend
Fix log with base 2
Added support for bilinear interpolation in NonUniformImage.
Added support for multiple histograms with data of different length
Fix step plots with log scale
Fix masked arrays with markers in non-Agg backends
Fix clip_on kwarg so it actually works correctly
Fix locale problems in SVG backend
fix quiver so masked values are not plotted
improve interactive pan/zoom in qt4 backend on windows

Fix more bugs in NaN/inf handling. In particular, path simplification (which does not handle NaNs or infs) will be turned off automatically when infs or NaNs are present. Also masked arrays are now converted to arrays with NaNs for consistent handling of masks and NaNs.
Backported memory leak fixes in _ttconv.cpp
Added masked array support to griddata.
Added optional C and reduce_C_function arguments to axes.hexbin(). This allows hexbin to accumulate the values of C based on the x,y coordinates and display in hexagonal bins.
Deprecated (raise NotImplementedError) all the mlab2 functions from matplotlib.mlab out of concern that some of them were not clean room implementations.
Rewrite of a significant portion of the clabel code (class ContourLabeler) to improve inlining.
Added Barbs polygon collection (similar to Quiver) for plotting wind barbs. Added corresponding helpers to Axes and pyplot as well. (examples/pylab_examples/barb_demo.py shows it off.)

Added scikits.delaunay as matplotlib.delaunay. Added griddata function in matplotlib.mlab, with example (griddata_demo.py) in pylab_examples. griddata function will use mpl_toolkits._natgrid if installed.
Re-introduced offset_copy that works in the context of the new transforms.
Committed patch by Ryan May to add get_offsets and set_offsets to Collections base class
Changed the "asarray" strategy in image.py so that colormapping of masked input should work for all image types
Rewrote cbook.delete_masked_points and corresponding unit test to support rgb color array inputs, datetime inputs, etc.
Renamed unit/axes_unit.py to cbook_unit.py and modified in accord with Ryan's move of delete_masked_points from axes to cbook.
Check for nan and inf in axes.delete_masked_points(). This should help hexbin and scatter deal with nans.
Added ability to manually select contour label locations. Also added a waitforbuttonpress function.
Fix bug with NaNs at end of path
Improve error handling in texmanager.
Added support for external backends with the "module://my_backend" syntax
Fix memory leak related to shared axes. Grouper should store weak references.
Bugfix: crash displaying fontconfig pattern
Bugfix: [ 2013963 ] update_datalim_bounds in Axes not works
Bugfix: [ 2014183 ] multiple imshow() causes gray edges
Fix rectangular axes patch on polar plots bug
Improve mathtext radical rendering
Improve mathtext superscript placement
Fix custom scales in pcolormesh
Implemented findobj method for artist and pyplot - see examples/pylab_examples/findobj_demo.py
Another attempt to fix TextWithDash
Removed Qt4 NavigationToolbar2.destroy -- it appears to have been unnecessary and caused a bug
Fixed tick positioning bug
Fix dashed text bug where text was at the wrong end of the dash
Fix mathtext bug for expressions like $x_{\leftarrow}$
Fix direction of horizontal/vertical hatches

Figure.figurePatch renamed Figure.patch, Axes.axesPatch renamed Axes.patch, Axes.axesFrame renamed Axes.frame, Axes.get_frame, which returns Axes.patch, is deprecated. Examples and users guide updated
Fix rendering quality of pcolor
Added "transparent" kwarg to savefig.
Applied Stefan's patch to draw a single centered marker over a line with numpoints==1
Use splines to render circles in scatter plots
Removed axes3d support and replaced it with a NotImplementedError for one release cycle
fix marker placement bug in backend_ps
[ 1978629 ] scale documentation missing/incorrect for log
Added closed kwarg to PolyCollection. Fixes bug 1994535 still missing lines on graph with svn (r 5548).
Added set/get_closed method to Polygon; fixes error in hist
Use relative font sizes (e.g. 'medium' and 'large') in rcsetup.py and matplotlibrc.template so that text will be scaled by default when changing rcParams['font.size']
Add a generic PatchCollection class that can contain any kind of patch.
Change pie chart label alignment to avoid having labels overwrite the pie

Added some helper functions to the mathtext parser to return bitmap arrays or write pngs to make it easier to use mathtext outside the context of an mpl figure. modified the mathpng sphinxext to use the mathtext png save functionality - see examples/api/mathtext_asarray.py
Use matplotlib.mathtext to render math expressions in online docs
Move PNG loading/saving to its own extension module, and remove duplicate code in _backend_agg.cpp and _image.cpp that does the same thing
Numerous mathtext bugfixes, primarily related to dpi-independence
Bar now applies the label only to the first patch only, and sets '_nolegend_' for the other patch labels. This lets autolegend work as expected for hist and bar
Fix text baseline alignment bug. [ 1985420 ] Repair of baseline alignment in Text._get_layout.
Committed Gregor's image resample patch to downsampling images with new rcparam image.resample

Don't install Enthought.Traits along with matplotlib. For matplotlib developers convenience, it can still be installed by setting an option in setup.cfg while we figure decide if there is a future for the traited config
Added range keyword arg to hist()
Moved list of backends to rcsetup.py; made use of lower case for backend names consistent; use validate_backend when importing backends subpackage

hist() revision, applied ideas proposed by Erik Tollerud and Olle Engdegard: make histtype='step' unfilled by default and introduce histtype='stepfilled'; use default color cycle; introduce reverse cumulative histogram; new align keyword
Fix closed polygon patch and also provide the option to not close the polygon
Fix some dpi-changing-related problems with PolyCollection, as called by Axes.scatter()
Fix image drawing so there is no extra space to the right or bottom
Added a figure title command subtitle as a Figure method and pyplot command -- see examples/figure_title.py
Added support for log to hist with histtype='step' and fixed a bug for log-scale stacked histograms
matplotlib.image.imread now no longer always returns RGBA -- if the image is luminance or RGB, it will return a MxN or MxNx3 array if possible. Also uint8 is no longer always forced to float.
Implement path clipping in PS backend
Fixed two bugs in texmanager.py: improved comparison of dvipng versions, fixed a bug introduced when get_grey method was added
Fix crashing of PDFs in xpdf and ghostscript when two-byte characters are used with Type 3 fonts
Allow keyword args to configure widget properties
Replaced '-' with u'\u2212' for minus sign
zero width/height Rectangles no longer influence the autoscaler. Useful for log histograms with empty bins
Fix rendering of composite glyphs in Type 3 conversion (particularly as evidenced in the Eunjin.ttf Korean font)

Rewrote the cm.ScalarMappable callback infrastructure to use cbook.CallbackRegistry rather than custom callback handling. Amy users of add_observer/notify of the cm.ScalarMappable should uae the cm.ScalarMappable.callbacksSM CallbackRegistry instead.
Fix TkAgg build on Ubuntu 8.04 (and hopefully a more general solution for other platforms, too.)
Added PIL support for loading images to imread (if PIL is available)
Provided a function and a method for controlling the plot color cycle.
Major revision of hist(). Can handle 2D arrays and create stacked histogram plots; keyword 'width' deprecated and rwidth (relative width) introduced; align='edge' changed to center of bin

Added support for ReST-based doumentation using Sphinx. Documents are located in doc/, and are broken up into a users guide and an API reference. To build, run the make.py files. Sphinx-0.4 is needed to build generate xml, which will be useful for rendering equations with mathml, use sphinx from svn until 0.4 is released
Fix segfault in TkAgg backend
Fix a "local variable unreferenced" bug in plotfile
Fix crash when Windows can not access the registry to determine font path [Bug 1966974]

removed some unneeded code w/ the python 2.4 requirement. cbook no longer provides compatibility for reversed, enumerate, set or izip. removed lib/subprocess, mpl1, sandbox/units, and the swig code. This stuff should remain on the maintenance branch for archival purposes
Reorganized examples dir
Added 'elinewidth' keyword arg to errorbar
Added 'cumulative' keyword arg to hist to plot cumulative histograms. For normed hists, this is normalized to one
Fix Tk backend segfault on some machines
Don't use stat on Windows (fixes font embedding problem)
Fix /singlequote (') in Postscript backend
Fix kerning in SVG when embedding character outlines
Switched to future numpy histogram semantic in hist
Fix strange colors when blitting in QtAgg and Qt4Agg
pass notify_axes_change to the figure's add_axobserver in the qt backends, like we do for the other backends.
Added step histograms.
On PyQt <= 3.14 there is no way to determine the underlying Qt version. [1851364]
Don't call sys.exit() when pyemf is not found [1924199]
Update _subprocess.c from upstream Python 2.5.2 to get a few memory and reference-counting-related bugfixes. See bug 1949978.
Added some record array editing widgets for gtk -- see examples/rec_edit*.py
Fix bug in mlab.sqrtm
Fix bug in SVG text with Mozilla-based viewers (the symbol tag is not supported)
Applied patch by Michiel de Hoon to add hexbin axes method and pyplot function
Enforce python >= 2.4; remove subprocess build
Enforce the numpy requirement at build time
Make numpy 1.1 and python 2.3 required when importing matplotlib
Fix compilation issues on VS2003
Fix sub/superscripts when the size of the font has been changed
Use "svg.embed_char_paths" consistently everywhere
Add support to MaxNLocator for symmetric axis autoscaling.
Fix double-zoom bug.
Speed up color mapping.
Speed up zooming and panning of dense images.
Fix global font rcParam setting after initialization time.

Revert commits 5002 and 5031, which were intended to avoid an unnecessary call to draw(). 5002 broke saving figures before show(). 5031 fixed the problem created in 5002, but broke interactive plotting. Unnecessary call to draw still needs resolution
Improve color validation in rc handling
Allow to use both linestyle definition arguments, '-' and 'solid' etc. in plots/collections
Fix saving to Unicode filenames with Agg backend (other backends appear to already work...)
Fix SVG backend bug that prevents copying and pasting in Inkscape
Removed an unnecessary call to draw() in the backend_qt* mouseReleaseEvent
Fix a pdf backend bug which sometimes caused the outermost gsave to not be balanced with a grestore.
Fixed a minor bug in ContourSet._process_linestyles when len(linestyles)==Nlev

Changed ma import statements to "from numpy import ma"; this should work with past and future versions of numpy, whereas "import numpy.ma as ma" will work only with numpy >= 1.05, and "import numerix.npyma as ma" is obsolete now that maskedarray is replacing the earlier implementation, as of numpy 1.05.
Removed an apparently unnecessary call to FigureCanvasAgg.draw in backend_qt*agg.
Workaround a bug in backend_qt4agg's blitting due to a buffer width/bbox width mismatch in _backend_agg's copy_from_bbox
Fix class Wx toolbar pan and zoom functions
Added some new rec array functionality to mlab (rec_summarize, rec2txt and rec_groupby). See examples/rec_groupby_demo.py.
Applied span selector patch
Update plotting() doc string to refer to getp/setp.
Fixed a problem with square roots in the pdf backend with usetex.
Fixed minor __str__ bugs so getp(gca()) works.
Added getters for title, xlabel, ylabel
Applied ginput patch and created examples/ginput_demo.py
Expose interpnames, a list of valid interpolation methods, as an AxesImage class attribute.
Added BoundaryNorm, with examples in colorbar_only.py and image_masked.py.
Force dpi=72 in pdf backend to fix picture size bug.
Fix doubly-included font problem in Postscript backend
Fix reference leak in ft2font Glyph objects.
Don't use unicode strings with usetex by default
Fix text spacing problems in PDF backend with *some* fonts, such as STIXGeneral.
Fix \sqrt with radical number (broken by making [ and ] work below)
Applied patch to improve the Qt4 backend. Uses Qt's builtin toolbars and statusbars.
Moved toolkits to mpl_toolkits, made mpl_toolkits a namespace package
Use setup.cfg to set the default parameters (tkagg, numpy) when building windows installers
Fix bug displaying [ and ] in mathtext
Fix bug when displaying a tick value offset with scientific notation. (Manifests itself as a warning that the \times symbol can not be found).
Use setup.cfg to set the default parameters (tkagg, numpy) when building windows installers

note.para: The matplotlib Python module is available in the following directories:
The directory is automatically added to the correct Python include.paths.d directory by the postinstall script.
matplotlib was compiled with support for three backends: GTK+, Tk. The GTK+ backend requires the installation of GTK+. The Tk backend does requires the installation of Tk.
